intro: Alona microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf water flea, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, rounded leaves that are typically less than 1 millimeter in diameter. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its structure consists of a short, thick rhizome with numerous small, floating leaves. Alona microphylla plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
